thread.title: Texas A&M receives verbal commitment from brother of current WR Josh Reynolds
thread.title_full: Texas A&M receives verbal commitment from brother of current WR Josh Reynolds | Dallas Morning News

author: EJ Holland
title: Texas A&M receives verbal commitment from brother of current WR Josh Reynolds
text:
Kevin Sumlin's time on the "Swagcopter" is paying off.
Texas A&M reeled in a verbal commitment from San Antonio Jay athlete Moses Reynolds on Monday night. He announced his decision via Twitter.
I've decided to commit to Texas A&M ðŸ‘ðŸ½ #GigEm
— #11 (@moses569) October 6, 2015 Reynolds committed to Texas A&M over offers from Baylor, Missouri, Oklahoma State, TCU and others. He is the younger brother of current Texas A&M junior wide receiver Josh Reynolds.
A three-star prospect, Reynolds is ranked as the No. 59 athlete in the nation and No. 108 overall prospect in the state, according to 247Sports Composite. At 6-foot-2, 185 pounds, Reynolds is projected to play wide receiver or safety at the next level.
Reynolds plays quarterback for San Antonio Jay and passed for 1,248 yards and 12 touchdowns while running for another 1,510 yards and 22 scores as a junior.
He is the 16th verbal pledge in Texas A&M's 2016 class.
